title: Upgrading from Store Version to Latest Version
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the current store build installed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has the current store build installed
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is able to go thru the on-boarding flow and select location on/off, favorite team and notification settings (note all these values) and log into the app with mlb.com account.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user logs out of the current Google Play Store account
and logs in to the Google Play Store with a whitelisted account (2017sophiaptest1@gmail.com / iaptester)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then they will see the app update available to install
and tapping on the "Update" button will successfully update the app to the alpha/test build
and the app will not crash
and the app maintain location, favorite team, notification settings as well as user account log in.

Verify the build number corresponds to the build under test (this can be located by selecting the About MLB tab for mobile and tablets or on the Settings screen for TV in the bottom right corner in small print)

title: Retaining Feature Access/Settings
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the current store build installed
and the user has logged in with an entitled account
and the user has set favorite team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user logs out of the current Google Play Store account
and logs in to the Google Play Store with a whitelisted account 
and updates the app
custom_expected:
Then the app will successfully update
and the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Team(s) will be retained
And the build number corresponds to the build under test (this can be located by selecting the About MLB tab for mobile and tablets or on the Settings screen for TV in the bottom right corner in small print)

title: Unsupported API Level
custom_preconds: Check with developers to verify the minSDK set on the project. At the time of this ticket's creation, that is at API 21, which corresponds to Android 5.0

custom_steps_separated.content: Install the app on any device running an Android OS version that is lower than 5.0
custom_steps_separated.expected:
If attempting to install/upgrade from the Play Store, user will either not see the app or not see that there is an upgrade available.

When installing from ADB, user will be presented with the error message: "Failure [INSTALL_FAILED_OLDER_SDK]"
